That’s why I asked the U.S. Department of Agriculture and Food and Drug Administration to thoroughly explain how their plan to jointly regulate this new industry will ensure each agency’s expertise is appropriately leveraged. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/4/enzi-asks-usda-fda-how-they-plan-to-oversee-cell-cultured-meat-production …

Biotech companies are developing a process to take cells from an animal, such as a cow or a chicken, and grow the cells in a lab into tissue for human consumption. It's important that a clear & functional regulatory framework be in place to ensure safety and proper labeling.

Businesses often look simple from the outside, but I’ve found it's important to get an inside look to better understand the decisions owners have to make. I always enjoy meeting the hard-working folks in our communities that run successful businesses.  https://bit.ly/2Pv1eCV
As part of my Wyoming Works tour, I spent the last two weeks visiting small businesses around the southwestern and central portions of the state. pic.twitter.com/SF2uMISuL6

I’ve had a wonderful time traveling around the southwestern portion of the state as part of my “Wyoming Works” tour. Diana and I toured several businesses, attended organizational meetings and spoke with folks to learn more about what’s going on in our communities and businesses. pic.twitter.com/1rAr6TvrkH

Agencies like the IRS & Social Security will very rarely call you without sending letters in the mail first. I urge you to warn your loved ones about these deceptive techniques. Read my letter here: https://www.moorcroftleader.com/story/2019/04/11/opinion/an-open-letter-to-wyoming-seniors-and-their-loved-ones/376.html …

I recently received scam phone calls claiming to be from the IRS and the Social Security Administration. It is vital for everyone to know not to give personal information like Social Security numbers or bank account information over the phone.

April is Financial Literacy Month! Financial education is all about having the information to plan for your future and the tools to understand the risks and rewards. The more financially literate people are, the better off our country will be. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/4/enzi-cosponsors-resolution-on-financial-literacy-month …

I spoke on the Senate floor today about a bill I introduced to protect Association Health Plans. Small businesses ought to have the opportunity to band together to negotiate & provide employees with comprehensive & affordable health insurance coverage.  https://bit.ly/2VEYsNE  pic.twitter.com/HPuvm4tXS0

Association Health Plans are a great option for sparsely populated states like Wyoming. That’s one of the reasons I intro'd a bill today to cement a @USDOL rule allowing businesses to pool together for health care coverage. https://www.greenriverstar.com/story/2019/04/10/opinion/our-view-enzis-plan-was-promising/6045.html …

These plans work for small businesses. One family shoe store probably cannot get an insurance company to play ball, but 1,000 family shoe stores probably could. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/4/senate-introduces-legislation-to-protect-association-health-plans-thousands-from-losing-health-insurance-coverage …

I introduced a bill today that would prevent thousands of people from losing health care coverage after a federal judge struck down the @USDOL's Association Health Plans rule, which made it easier for small businesses to band together to provide affordable health insurance.
Projects like the Millennium Bulk Terminal in Washington would provide a boost not only for Wyoming’s coal mines, but for America’s economy as a whole.
I appreciate that @realDonaldTrump is looking to tear down or clarify unnecessary regulations that discourage healthy energy development that helps create jobs and strengthens our energy exports.

At a Finance hearing, I urged the IRS commissioner to open the Cheyenne Taxpayer Assistance Center full-time so WY residents can get assistance they need & deserve. I also asked about solutions for undeliverable correspondence that wastes taxpayer dollars.  https://bit.ly/2VHlnrL  pic.twitter.com/6Kr98T2r3R

It was wonderful to honor more than 160 students who earned Congressional Awards – 70 of which were Gold Medalists – in Cheyenne over the weekend. I am always proud of these Wyoming students for their willingness to serve their communities.  https://bit.ly/2wucpl7  pic.twitter.com/Qff3MrIKVm

I also asked Under Secretary of Defense Norquist about the importance of modernizing the nuclear triad, especially ICBMs at F.E. Warren in Cheyenne. He said it's absolutely essential & in order to rely on a deterrent, you must be able to replace them. https://bit.ly/2uXZOaC

Congress has a duty to our brave service men and women, as well as hardworking taxpayers, to ensure that the hundreds of billions of dollars appropriated annually to provide for our nation’s defense is well spent. I held a hearing today on the DOD FY 2020 budget request. pic.twitter.com/kXLAWi4Nmz

Closing Taxpayer Assistance Centers presents challenges to many folks – especially during filing season. I introduced a bill today that would require the IRS to provide notice before closing centers to ensure taxpayers have access to resources they need. https://www.enzi.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/4/enzi-introduces-bill-requiring-advance-notice-before-closing-taxpayer-assistance-centers …

I am honored to receive the @USChamber’s Spirit of Enterprise Award. I will continue my support for growing businesses and expanding opportunities across the country. #SOE19 pic.twitter.com/9nsJW4ZGwt

Planning for emergencies is not a precise science, but I believe Congress can do a lot better than just calling it an emergency and adding to the debt. While better budgeting for natural disasters won’t fix all of our financial problems, it is a good place to start.

I spoke on the Senate floor today about the need to improve our fiscal situation – and that includes improving the way we provide disaster relief. Disaster relief funding must be built into our budgets. pic.twitter.com/dRM9F5quAt

I cosponsored @SenMcSallyAZ's bill to conserve water in the Colorado River. I’m glad the 7 states of the CR basin worked together in developing this plan to help protect those who rely on the river & ensure there's sufficient water for years to come. https://bit.ly/2I37mk5
